content.rendered:
Hawaii’s amazing attractions makes it among the top tourist destinations globally. From archaeological sites to botanical gardens, volcanic eruption to zoos, the island provides a variety of outdoor experiences to meet the interests of every tourist. Here are some of Hawaii’s attractions:

01. Waimea Canyon State Park, Kauai

This stunning canyon is also known as the Grand Canyon of the Pacific. It measures 10 miles long, 1 mile wide and more than 3.6 feet deep. The play of light and shadow on the colorful rock layers all day long is extraordinary. You can pass the time here standing in one of the rocks and watch the reactions on the faces of first-time visitors; they gaze at the beauties with wide-eyed fascination and they become speechless when they see this breathtaking site.

02. Hanauma Bay Nature Preserve

This bay has numerous spectacular natural resources that are worth seeing and learning from. While in this natural beauty, you will not only get the opportunity to know more about their conservation programs but also go swimming and snorkeling.

03. Diamond Head State Monument

This is a very popular tourist attraction, located in the southeast of Hawaii. If you’re a hiking lover, make an effort to visit this monument because you’ll be able to cover the journey to the summit, which is about 1.4 miles. However, you’ll need a flashlight since you’ll have to pass through a long, dark tunnel. Once you reach the top, you’ll be able to have a beautiful view of Honolulu and its surroundings.

04. Waimea Arboretum and Botanical Gardens

Here, you will get to connect yourself with various botanical collections, as well as swim in a crystal clear pool under the blazing sun. That is not all, a visit to the Audubon Centre in Waimea Valley will surely leave you will a memorable experience.

05. Panaewa Rainforest Zoo

This zoo has different kinds of rainforest animals and endangered species, including Nene geese, lemurs and spider monkeys among others. Other than the animals, this place also has a botanical garden, where you can see various plant species. It’s open daily and there’s no entry fee, so you have no excuse for not visiting this natural beauty.

06. Pu’uhonua o Honaunau National Historical Park

Located on the Big Island, this 182-acre park contains several archeological sites of Hawaii. This place was once a residence of Hawaiian royalty, defeated military, as well as those who broke the ancient Hawaiian law. Visit this place and get to the enjoy the view of sea turtles sunbathing and playing on the beach. Don’t forget your camera; there’s a lot of beautiful scenes to capture here.

These are just some of the wonders of Hawaii’s tourist attractions. There are a lot more to this paradise that you need to explore either alone or with friends and family. Make an effort to visit Hawaii; you’ll be amazed by the beauty of this island.
